slug: /140
title: "This Week In React #140: React Labs, Server Components, Next.js, Remix, Storybook, Astro, refs, Ark, Impala, Docusaurus, Expo-Blur, WebView, AsyncContext..."

Hi everyone!
I'm just back from vacations: we catch up with 2 weeks of news!

translations.fr: **[React-admin - Le Framework Open-Source pour les applications B2B](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react)**
translations.en: **[React-admin - Le framework open source pour les applications B2B](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react)**

segments.source_content: Single-Page-Apps are still the best choice to create admin panels, B2B apps, and ERP systems on top of REST/GraphQL APIs. [React-admin](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react) is **the open-source framework of reference for building SPAs**.

translations.fr: Les Single-Page-Apps restent le meilleur choix pour crÃ©er des panneaux d'administration, des applications B2B et des systÃ¨mes ERP sur des API REST/GraphQL. [React-admin](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react) est **le framework open-source de rÃ©fÃ©rence pour construire des SPA**.
translations.en: Les applications monopages (SPA) restent le meilleur choix pour crÃ©er des panneaux d'administration, des applications B2B et des systÃ¨mes ERP sur des API REST/GraphQL. [React-admin](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_term=this-week-in-react) est **le framework open source de rÃ©fÃ©rence pour construire des SPA**.

segments.source_content: React-admin offers a library of 150+ business-oriented components. It's not a UI kit: it leverages the best UI kit for React, MUI. React-admin boosts developer productivity by assembling the best-in-class libraries, managing all the repetitive stuff you shouldnâ€™t have to deal with.

**[React Labs: What We've Been Working On â€“ March 2023](https://react.dev/blog/2023/03/22/react-labs-what-we-have-been-working-on-march-2023)**

translations.fr: **[React Labs : Ce sur quoi nous avons travaillÃ© â€“ Mars 2023](https://react.dev/blog/2023/03/22/react-labs-what-we-have-been-working-on-march-2023)**
translations.en: **[React Labs : Ce sur quoi nous avons travaillÃ© â€“ Mars 2023](https://react.dev/blog/2023/03/22/react-labs-what-we-have-been-working-on-march-2023)**

segments.source_content: An official update from the R&D around React that addresses different topics:

translations.fr: Une mise Ã  jour officielle de la R&D autour de React qui aborde diffÃ©rents sujets :
translations.en: Une mise Ã  jour officielle de la R&D autour de React qui aborde diffÃ©rents sujets :

segments.source_content:
- React Server Components. A nice implementation is already available in Next.js via App Router. RSCs with async/await should also be able to run in a client app. I have the impression they want to unify client/server side model and I think [AsyncContext](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1639183216799100928) will be great for that!
- Asset loading: integration with Suspense for loading CSS, font and images ([more details](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1637102880850059264)).
- Document Metadata: first-class support for an API for `<head>` metadata with streaming support.
- React Optimizing Compiler: no longer presented as an auto-memoizing compiler, but as a reactivity compiler. [React Forget has reached a milestone](https://twitter.com/en_JS/status/1641494974893281282), and they are focusing on integration.
- Offscreen Rendering: an innovation I'm really looking forward to, which differentiates React from other frameworks. Meta is testing prerendering on React-Native apps with positive results.
- Transition Tracing: permits to detect slow transitions.

translations.fr:
- Composants Serveur React. Une belle implÃ©mentation est dÃ©jÃ  disponible dans Next.js via App Router. Les RSC avec async/await devraient Ã©galement pouvoir fonctionner dans une application client. J'ai l'impression qu'ils veulent unifier les modÃ¨les cÃ´tÃ© client/serveur et je pense que [AsyncContext](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1639183216799100928) sera gÃ©nial pour Ã§a !
- Chargement des ressources : intÃ©gration avec Suspense pour charger CSS, polices et images ([plus de dÃ©tails](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1637102880850059264)).
- MÃ©tadonnÃ©es du document : support natif d'une API pour les mÃ©tadonnÃ©es `<head>` avec prise en charge du streaming.
- Compilateur d'optimisation React : prÃ©sentÃ© non plus comme un compilateur de mÃ©moÃ¯sation automatique, mais comme un compilateur de rÃ©activitÃ©. [React Forget a atteint une Ã©tape importante](https://twitter.com/en_JS/status/1641494974893281282), et ils se concentrent sur l'intÃ©gration.
- Rendu hors Ã©cran : une innovation que j'attends vraiment, qui diffÃ©rencie React des autres frameworks. Meta teste le prÃ©rendu sur des apps React Native avec des rÃ©sultats positifs.
- TraÃ§age des transitions : permet de dÃ©tecter les transitions lentes.
translations.en:
- Composants Serveur React. Une belle implÃ©mentation est dÃ©jÃ  disponible dans Next.js via App Router. Les RSC avec async/await devraient Ã©galement pouvoir s'exÃ©cuter dans une application cliente. J'ai l'impression qu'ils veulent unifier les modÃ¨les cÃ´tÃ© client/serveur et je pense que [AsyncContext](https://twitter.com/sebastienlorber/status/1639183216799100928) sera gÃ©nial pour Ã§a !
- Chargement des ressources : intÃ©gration avec Suspense pour charger CSS, polices et images ([plus de dÃ©tails](https://twitter.com/acdlite/status/1637102880850059264)).
- MÃ©tadonnÃ©es de document : support natif pour une API des mÃ©tadonnÃ©es `<head>` avec support du streaming.
- Compilateur d'optimisation React : prÃ©sentÃ© non plus comme un compilateur de mÃ©moÃ¯sation automatique, mais comme un compilateur de rÃ©activitÃ©. [React Forget a atteint un jalon](https://twitter.com/en_JS/status/1641494974893281282), et ils se concentrent sur l'intÃ©gration.
- Rendu hors Ã©cran : une innovation que j'attends vraiment avec impatience, qui diffÃ©rencie React des autres frameworks. Meta teste le prÃ©rendu sur des apps React-Native avec des rÃ©sultats positifs.
- TraÃ§age des transitions : permet de dÃ©tecter les transitions lentes.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ¥‡ [React.dev on ProductHunt - Product of the day](https://twitter.com/ProductHunt/status/1640956972450328577)
- ğŸ‘¤ [Tom Occhino](https://twitter.com/tomocchino/status/1640800001625411606) and [Dominic Gannaway](https://twitter.com/trueadm/status/1640761270566633472) joined Vercel.
- ğŸ‘€ Server Components can [lazily send modules](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1638760757239087104) to client.
- ğŸ‘€ [Jarred Summer - "Server Components is coming in Bun v0.6.0"](https://twitter.com/jarredsumner/status/1642821108402630657)
- ğŸ‘€ [Lee Robinson - "Improved sitemap support is coming to Nextjs"](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1639639575843729409)
- ğŸ‘€ [Lee Robinson - "The Next.js App Router now supports static exports!"](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1640445075959484418)
- ğŸ‘€ [Astro roadmap - Client-side Routing](https://github.com/withastro/roadmap/issues/532): Astro plans to implement client-side navigation. Opt-in: Astro remains by default an MPA framework.
- ğŸ‘€ [Vercel - Remix without Limits](https://vercel.com/blog/vercel-remix-integration-with-edge-functions-support): Vercel now offers first-class integration with Remix.
- ğŸ¦ [Dan Abramov - "weâ€™ve changed our forms recommendations to emphasize uncontrolled inputs"](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1641830612955803650)
- ğŸ“œ [Learning React from two Angles in 2023](https://www.robinwieruch.de/learning-react/): it is possible to learn React as a library, or as a framework/architecture (Next.js). Not easy to know where to start for a beginner.
- ğŸ“œ [Refs in React: from access to DOM to imperative API](https://www.developerway.com/posts/refs-from-dom-to-api): good intro to refs, forwardRef, useImperativeHandle.
- ğŸ“œ [Rethinking React best practices](https://frontendmastery.com/posts/rethinking-react-best-practices/): describes well the trend of React which is progressively moving from a simple UI library to a full-stack architecture.
- ğŸ“œ [isMounted tricks are code-smell](https://reacttraining.com/blog/isMounted-tricks-are-code-smell): if you use this kind of pattern, I think it will become a problem with the future Offscreen API.
- ğŸ“œ [Setting State On An Unmounted Component](https://reacttraining.com/blog/setting-state-on-unmounted-component)
- ğŸ“œ [The useEffect cleanup and the two circumstances it's called](https://reacttraining.com/blog/useEffect-cleanup)
- ğŸ“œ [How Will the Future of Web Development Be Affected by Influential New React Docs?](https://luketheweb.dev/blog/how-will-the-future-of-web-development-be-affected-by-influential-new-react-docs)
- ğŸ“œ [Making Tanstack Table 1000x faster with a 1 line change](https://jpcamara.com/2023/03/07/making-tanstack-table.html)
- ğŸ“œ [How to build zero-CLS A/B tests with Next.js and Vercel Edge Config](https://vercel.com/blog/zero-cls-experiments-nextjs-edge-config)
- ğŸ“œ [Custom fonts without compromise using Next.js and `next/font`](https://vercel.com/blog/nextjs-next-font)
- ğŸ“œ [Animated page transitions with Remix's nested routes](https://www.jacobparis.com/guides/remix-animated-page-transitions)
- ğŸ“¦ [Storybook 7.0](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v7.0.0): nice release with Vite, CSF3, API frameworks, MDX2... The new features have already been presented before, but we'll probably get a blog post soon?
- ğŸ“¦ [Server Components Demo updated](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1641596168290312195)
- ğŸ“¦ [Ark UI](https://ark-ui.com/): the Chakra UI team introduced a new universal UI lib (React, Vue, Solid) based on Zag.js state machines.
- ğŸ“¦ [Simple-RSC](https://github.com/bholmesdev/simple-rsc): simple and annotated Server Components implementation, related to a [long stream between Ben Holmes (Astro) and Dan Abramov](https://twitter.com/BHolmesDev/status/1641659705444401152).
- ğŸ“¦ [Impala - A very simple static React framework](https://github.com/ascorbic/impala)
- ğŸ“¦ [Webpack-RSC](https://twitter.com/unstubbable/status/1641495749627109380)

- ğŸ“¦ [Styling Addon: configure styles and themes in Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/styling-addon-configure-styles-and-themes-in-storybook/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Docusaurus 2.4](https://docusaurus.io/blog/releases/2.4)
- ğŸ“¦ [Framer Motion 10.9 - Timelines](https://twitter.com/mattgperry/status/1639286184965750790)
- ğŸ“¦ [Planby 2.3.0 - Schedule / Timeline for React with](https://dev.to/kozerkarol/schedule-timeline-for-react-with-planby-223-2djf)
- ğŸ“¦ [Ionic 7](https://ionic.io/blog/ionic-7-is-here)
- ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ“ [React.gg](https://react.gg): new promising React course in private beta
- ğŸ¥ [Theo - So I had a call with Dan...](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qZzmUVspiEo): I agree that the client/server components naming is not ideal, and "use interactive" seems to me a good idea.

## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}

- ğŸ“œ [Storybook for React Native (6.5)](https://storybook.js.org/blog/storybook-for-react-native-6-5/): great news for Storybook users on React-Native, the integration is catching up with Storybook web, adopting CSF, Controls, Args, and should soon be compatible with Storybook 7.0. With the new Metro features (`require.context`), the need to generate a story index should soon disappear.
- ğŸ“œ [How Migrating from Vanilla Redux to Redux Toolkit Improved State Management in Shopify POS](https://shopify.engineering/react-redux-toolkit-migration): feedback on an incremental migration to RTK, removing 3500 lines.
- ğŸ‘€ [RFC: DOM traversal and layout APIs in React Native](https://github.com/react-native-community/discussions-and-proposals/pull/607): new advanced API could unlock the implementation of features like `MutationObserver`, `IntersectionObserver`...
- ğŸ‘€ [View Flattening on iOS](https://twitter.com/SamuelSusla/status/1641086480675225601): React-Native could already optimize on Android by avoiding to create useless native views. Samuel explains how it works and announces that now it works for iOS too.
- ğŸ‘€ [Expo Router + Apple Handoff demo](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1641850192839180315): great iOS innovation to switch between web and mobile, and it should work well with universal Expo Router apps ğŸ‘Œ
- ğŸ¥ [The Joy of Painting with React Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GQqL1OCoOFM): new style of Skia ASMR video by William Candillon ğŸ˜„
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Native WebView 12.0](https://twitter.com/titozzz/status/1642147926762815490): new architecture support.
- ğŸ“¦ [React-Native 0.76.1](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.71.6): new releases fixing XCode build issues.
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo-Blur - Android support](https://twitter.com/aleqsio/status/1638893843457212418): BlurView will soon be cross-platform.
- ğŸ¦ [Tzvetan Mikov - "Messenger for MacOS is a React Native app."](https://twitter.com/tmikov/status/1642630975430754305)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR 263 - Shopify Goes React Native!](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-263-shopify-goes-react-native)
- ğŸ‘¥ [Chain React](https://chainreactconf.com/): conf in Portland, May 18-19 (-10% discount with "thisweekinreact" code).

segments.source_content: Do you want to work on the world's most used apps? Would you like to co-create the React Native technology? Join the Callstack team of React & React Native leaders. Check our website for more details. We are looking forward to seeing your application - show us what you've got!
